title: Tuesday afternoon news briefing: Brexit deal is 'essentially impossible' says Downing Street after call between Boris Johnson and Angela Merkel
text:
PS - Glasgow's Lord Provost is under pressure to resign from both Labour and the Tories after it emerged she has charged the taxpayer £8,000 for clothes and beauty products, including 23 pairs of shoes, five coats and a £200 designer hat.

Man named America's deadliest serial killer after confessions

An inmate who claims to have killed more than 90 women across the US is now considered to be the deadliest serial killer in the country's history, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said. Samuel Little, who has been behind bars since 2012, told investigators last year he was responsible for about 90 killings nationwide between 1970 and 2005. In a news release, the FBI announced federal crime analysts believe all of his confessions are credible, and officials have been able to verify 50 confessions so far. The FBI provided 30 haunting drawings of some of his victims - colour portraits drawn by Little himself in prison. See how he compares to the country's other most deadly killers.

King removes five from royal family amid concern for taxpayers

The King of Sweden has removed five of his grandchildren from the country's Royal Court in a historic step which has had Swedish republicans celebrating with Champagne. In his surprise decision, King Carl XVI Gustaf ruled the children of Princess Madeleine and Prince Carl-Philip would from now on be treated as private citizens. This means they will no longer have the title of Royal Highness, will not be expected to carry out official duties, and will no longer receive a share of the royal family's state-funded annual allowance. Yet royal commentators have said it's wrong to see it as a demotion. Here's why.

Video: Are Extinction Rebellion harming their cause?

Lord Andrew Fraser, who was once a Tory Party treasurer, has clearly had enough of the Extinction Rebellion protests. He confronted activists in his dressing gown this morning as the second day of mass actions began. But is Extinction Rebellion harming its climate change cause? Scroll down to watch.
